Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Another dead place. I tol' you. Let's get out to the islands.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: The radio signals were coming from this area.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Not from the city. In every city it's the same. Dead. Let's get out to the barrier islands. If there are survivors sending those signals that's where we'll find them.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Plenty of time for the islands. The rest of our...life...on the islands...I think.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: We gotta see if there are others here. We came all this way. We're gonna check it out.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Ptoooo! Nothing! Dry as a bone. No gas. Let's get outa here.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Check them all. And check the tanks under the pumps.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: HELLO. IS THERE ANYONE THERE? HELLO. HELLOOOOOOO....

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Dios mia.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: I tol' him. I tol' him this is a dead place. Like all the others.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: AY! GASOLINA! GASOLINA!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I have to stop the infection... Querrida...

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: HEY ! WHAT ARE WE DOIN' THIS FOR? WE CAN STICK TOGETHER. WE CAN USE EACH OTHER'S GUNS.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: You got a boat.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: I don't know where they went, man. I don't know. I swear.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: YOU....YOU MOTHERFUCKERS!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: MIGUELITO. MI VIDA. MIGUEL MIO.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: JESUS CHRIST! GET UP HERE, WOMAN! GET THE HELL UP HERE!

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: TONY....TONY....

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: PULL IN! GET THE OTHERS.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Help me get him to the boat.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: Leave him.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Help me or die.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Aaaaaaah...my God...my God...I am heartily sorry...for having offended Thee....offended Thee...

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Shhhhh....Tony. Rest, rest.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: I detest all my sins...because... because of Thy just punishment... because of Thy...just...punish...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: He is dying. I will end his pain.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: NOOOOOOOOO!

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: ...but most of all because...they offend Thee, my God...Who art all good...and deserving...deserving of all my love...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: He is dying. He knows it.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: You are dying, too.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No. The disease was cut away from me. I will live. I will live.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: I firmly resolve...with the... with the help...the help of...of Thy grace...

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Tony...TONY!

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: NO! YOU CAN'T!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: It must be done. You know this. It must by done to keep him from...

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: It won't happen to him! It won't happen to him! You heard his prayer. His prayer will save him. He could never become one of...one of those... devils.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Prayers have no power to save. The knife can save. It can cut the disease away. The bullet. It can shatter the brain where the evil takes seed. These are saviours...our new saviours...our only saviours.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: We must wait. One day the curse will pass. One day a dead man will... will...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: One day a dead man will refuse to return, and that man will be a saint. The first saint of our century. That's a prayer, too. A catechism. Something the priests tell us to believe.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: You can believe this, Miguel. I'll kill you if you shoot. We must wait. I'll....I'll do it....I'll do it myself....when it needs to be done.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No. You won't be able to do it. He will rise. He will rise and you... you will die.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: It looks uninhabited. What do you think?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I think we should burn the church. Kill the priest and burn the church. It's the only way. The only way.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: I'm pullin' in.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: DATURA!!! DATURA!!! MIRA. DATURA!!!

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: What's he saying?

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: His madness....could be from shock.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No. I didn't stop the infection in time. I know.  Don't worry. When he dies, I won't be like Maria. I'll shoot him.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: DATURA!!! DATURA!!! DATURA METEL!!!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No. No shooting. Not until we're sure we're alone on this island.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No. No, thank you. No ice. Straight up, please. No ice. Thank you.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: NO ICE, I SAID!!! NOOOOO ICE!!!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Burn the church. Kill the priest and burn the church. Burn....

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: I dunno. Landing pad for a helicopter? I dunno.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: It's some kind of....elevator. There must be something under the ground here....maybe....military.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Look.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: What do we do? Let'em know we're here....or what?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Let's just....wait a minute. Get a better look.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: OH, MY GOD!!!

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: It can't be. Are we truly in hell?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What is that? Could that be....?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No. They must have gotten them to accept....other things. They wouldn't be feeding them with....they wouldn't...

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: You'll get used to this, Tyler. It's the only way. They don't bite the hand that feeds.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: GET THAT THING AWAY FROM THE OTHERS! BRING IT HERE!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: We have visitors. Let's go men.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Hah! If only the rest of you ladies would obey orders the way they do.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: THAT'S IT, YOU WORM-EATEN SLIME ! YOU FOUL- SMELLING, PUSS-FACED MAGGOTS! I TOLD YOU I'D FIND YOU REAL ACTION, DIDN'T I? YOU CORRUPTION! YOU FILTH! YOU'RE LEARNING! YOU'RE GETTING BETTER....GETTING BETTER...GETTING BETTER, YOU SCUM!

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: NO! NOOOOO! NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: SPREAD OUT, MEN! OPEN FIRE!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: BURN THE CHURCH! KILL THE PRIEST!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: KILL THE PRIEST! BURN THE CHURCH! BURN! BURN! BURN! BURN! BURN!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Kill the priest.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: Yes...yes, do it...please...you can't let me die this way...please. Destroy me. A bullet...in the head...I don't want to become...one of...one of them.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Take his weapon, Tyler.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Take his gun, ass hole. He still has the strength to pull a trigger.

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: Please...senor...destroy me...one bullet...please.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Maybe. We'll have a little talk first. Then....maybe...I can help you out. String him up.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: They can handle it, Tyler. You've been buckin' for a shit detail lately so here's one you're gonna love. We've got two dead. Cut the heads off and get the bodies underground to the refrigerators. Fast. It's a hot day.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Tyler. Just our men. Not him.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: His head stays where it is. He and I never really had the chance to get acquainted. When he comes back...I'll get another shot at it... Ha ha ha ha...

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: Please....shoot me.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: And if I don't? If I don't you'll come back after your death. You'll come back and find yourself hanging there...wanting to eat...needing to eat human flesh. You hate that thought, don't you? That's the ultimate sin for most of you fools, isn't it?

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: After hanging up there a few days you will be mad for food...crazed! You will lust for it! YOU WILL BE WORSE THAN ANY OF THEM!

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: NO...NOOOOOOO...SHOOT ME! SHOOT ME! SHOOOOOOOOOT MEEEEEEEEE!!!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: I'll bargain with you. How many of you are on the island?

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: Two of us...only two of us...me...and him.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: I don't believe you, rebel. Where are your headquarters? On the mainland?

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: The mainland...is dead...a dead place...nobody there...

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Where are your headquarters, rebel? Tell me or I'll let you hang there forever...FOREVER!

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: There are no...headquarters. There are no...rebels. Only the walking dead. Don't you see. They have won.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Then why did you come here?

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: To look...look for a place...a place to live in...an empty place...a... new...place...

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: How did you know we were on this island? Do others know? Will others come?

Speaker: chico
Dialogue: Nooooo. Believe me. There are no others...no rebels...nobody...it's over...it's ooooo....

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Where are you going, Tyler?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: My..."detail", sir. We're going to bury the heads.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: No time for that. I'll take care of them.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Just....following procedure, sir. They're entitled to burial.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: I said, I'll take care of them. Just leave them there. Go help with the rest of the gear.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: WHO FIRED THAT SHOT? WHO FIRED THAT SHOT?

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Goddammit, somebody's gonna tell me who fired that shot or I'll have every last one of you chopped up for feed!!!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Step up here, Tyler.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Sir!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: You fired that shot, didn't you?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: No, sir.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Let me see your weapon.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: It's been fired.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: In the battle, sir.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: It may be that none of these chicken-shits will talk while the whole troop is present...but I know some of these men well. I'm sure that a few private conversations will tell me what I already know. You may have earned yourself some time in the Stalag, Tyler.  Cut him down. That's another head for you to chop off. Leave it with the others. Take the rest of his body down to the freezers. Move it, shit hill.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's alright. It's alright. Don't be afraid. We're friends.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: There are soldiers near here. Guards. I'll take my hand away if you won't scream.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Right. We better get away from that Bee. He might have friends.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Bees. That's what we call the dead... the walking dead...here on Gasparilla's island.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Gasparilla?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He was a pirate who sailed these waters long ago. His name is bein' borrowed these days by the long lost Henry Dickerson.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Governor Dickerson? Of Florida?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: That's the man. He's been holed up here ever since the shit hit the fan. Him and his family owned these islands 'round here. They was leasin' this one to the Fed. The whole underneath is dug out. There was missiles here and laboratories and bomb proof housing, nuclear power, all o' that. Now this is Dickerson's....Gasparilla's... private fortress. Him and a bunch o' his cronies from all the best golf courses in Tallahassee...and his private army, of course.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: We ran up against a platoon of soldiers. There were actually walking dead...in uniform...with guns.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Captain Rhodes and his Red Coat Bees. They could sting, sister. We know you came up against 'em. We been watchin' you since you landed. Couldn't help. I'm sorry for that. We ain't supposed to be outside. If we was spotted it could....well, it could be the end of everything.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Give that to me. Get behind me. Stay behind me.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Thanks. I can fight my own battles.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I know you can. Like I said, we been watchin' you.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We found nine entrances to the Cave so far, and we ain't got the whole thing near charted yet. That's what we was doin' out here today. Huntin' for entrances.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: The man I was with...until today... believed that praying was for blind men who couldn't see the truth.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: How we gonna break the curse without a prayer or two.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Curse?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What is it if it ain't a curse?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: It's a disease. It's a...a bug...a parasite that infects the brain.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: That sounds like a curse to me.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: We thought we were escaping here. We thought we'd found an uninhabited island. Christ! This place is a worse nightmare than anything I've seen yet!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'm sure that's true, miss. And that's why we're doin' what we're doin'. What's happenin' underground here is just what Lucifer planned for this sinful race o' man. But we're gonna beat Lucifer. We're gonna put an end to what's happenin' here.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Oh, what did I run into? A bunch o' Jesus nuts? Religiosos? Prayer won't stop a bullet from one of those storm troopers and prayer won't keep one of those monsters from eatin' your liver for lunch.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: That's why we didn't use prayers on this here white coat 'til after he was destroyed. We ready to fight when we have to. And we gotta fight now.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Look. I BEEN fightin', mister. I been fightin' for what feels like a hundred years and I'm finished. I don't need religion. I don't need prayers. I need a couple guns and a couple hands. We can sail on outa here. Find another island where there ain't so much....traffic.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You think you can find your boat? There's a thousand little inlets and backwaters all through here. You remember all the ways you turned to get where you are now? You leave yourself a trail?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We didn't see the exact spot but we know about where you landed. But we ain't ready to take you there. Not yet. You see...we need guns, too.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I can find it myself. I didn't come that far.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Farther than you think. You'll get lost. You will. And there's Bees all through the jungle. I ain't lyin' to ya. Religiosos don't lie.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No. They just try to hold you for ransom. Fuck you, Moses! I'm outa here!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We don't need her guns that bad. Billy boy.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We'll split up. Billy, you go with Spider. Just an hour or two tonight, that's all. Rhodes might have extra guards on after all the commotion. We'll meet up at number six and go back home together.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Are you gonna pause to say words over the dead this time or can we be on our way?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: There's activity in the dormitory!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: This is Mary Henried. Did anyone enter the dormitory?

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Take it, friend. Take it. It's a present. From me to you.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Just remember who gives you favours.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Well, Bub. I've heard about you. Miss Henried's pride and joy.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Surly sonofabitch. I want to make friends, Bub. Friends. I have one more goodie in my sack here.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Come, come, Miss Science. You've seen worse.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: God....damn you, Rhodes!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: God has damned us all. Are my atrocities worse than yours?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: You have ruined weeks of work here! We've been trying to wean these specimens onto alligator meat!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: No wonder they're so....hungry.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I didn't realise! Those were de-caps! I didn't know that....de-caps... revived!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Any dead whose brains are intact will revive.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: But...we bury the heads. Oh. God! It must be torture for them!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: They are brutes without feeling. Though I admit that I've requested cremation for myself. Burial is an archaic tradition, even more ridiculous now than it ever was. To say nothing of the...spacing problem...on a small island like this.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I thought the purpose of decapitation was to...to...

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: The purpose of decapitation is to preserve as much...food...as possible. The purpose for feeding is to keep the beasts on our side. The fact that they can be taught to clean up our garbage or to fire a gun is a convenient side benefit, not the primary goal. The primary goal is to keep ourselves from becoming their supper. Keep them fed and they behave. Keep them hungry and they revert back to being the animals that they have always been. You saw them in there.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: You gave them a fresh taste of blood!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: They will never be satisfied with anything else, Miss Henried. They want human flesh. I'm prepared to take whatever steps are necessary to see to it they don't get mine! Not while I'm still using it!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Did you know? About the de-caps?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I'd never seen it before.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: But you knew.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What else is there, doctor? What else do you people know that the rest of us don't?

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: You can't run away from the planet, Miss Science. You can't even run away from the island, heh heh.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Leave me alone, you...COCKSUCKER!!!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: You're....you're disgusting! You're....FILTH!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: And you're the one who builds the bomb and they says, 'I hope it'll never actually be used'.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Julie Grant is a behaviouralist. She's not medical. She hasn't been as...exposed to...to things...as some of the rest of us. She'll be alright. I'll talk to her. She'll be alright.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Oh, I have no doubt.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: If you put her on the shit list because of her reaction here tonight I'll go to Dickerson.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Ah, yes, our noble Gasparilla does seem to favour you lately. I understand he assigned you a roommate of your choice. The rest of us have to pick names out of a hat.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Rhodes, you and I had a roll in the hay together when I first got here. It was a wholly unsatisfying experience which I do not want to, and which I never will repeat! So give up, mister! I'm going home...to that roommate you mentioned.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Take your hands off me! Right now!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Maybe you'll change your mind when it starts getting too lonely for you.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: I'm not entirely without influence myself, Miss Science. I had your roommate assigned...by Gasparilla... to my platoon. What's his name? Tyler? Yes. Toby Tyler.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: I had an unfortunate little run-in with him today. In fact...you might say that Mr. Tyler is in big trouble with the...authorities.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: You better not mess with me, Rhodes. I'd love to serve your balls to those Red Coats for lunch! Think about it!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: No, Miss Science. You're the one who needs to do some thinking.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Toby...thank God...wait here. I gotta find out what's goin' on.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Hey. Slow down. What is it?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Some of Rhodes' men. At the door.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: That bastard. I didn't think he'd make his move so fast.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: It's because of me.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Oh, bullshit, Mary. It's because Rhodes is a prick.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I want you to leave. Then maybe...

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: We're both gonna leave. Leave the island. I've been talkin' to Tricks. We think we can smuggle out one of those inflatable rafts. They're crated up real small. They've got air canisters. There's food inside. Even a little motor.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I am not...a guerilla fighter, Toby. I'm not a pioneer. I'm not...I'm not strong that way. I need...

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Need what? Civilised order like we have down here? Christ!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I can work here. Maybe my work can help...help everyone. I can do more good with access to this equipment than I can off in some wasteland.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: For the good of mankind. That's what every monster-maker says.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: We're gettin' out. Me and Tricks. I want you to come with us. I want that more than anything. I'll send word. I'll let you know a time and a place to meet. We probably won't be able to wait around so if you're not there on the dot...well...if you're not there, I'll know you're not comin'.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: I don't know what they're gonna do to me. I figure they'll just send me out to Stalag Seventeen but if...if it's worse than that...Tricks will know. Stay in touch with Tricks.

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: You Tyler?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: You're under arrest. I'll take your weapon.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: What's he supposed to have done? What are the charges?

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Dunno, ma'm. We're on orders.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Look...I'm Mary Henried. I'm with the special conditioning center. I'm not without influence...

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Mary.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I'll have somebody's ass for this. I'll have your ass, soldier. I'm not gonna stand here and...

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: MARY!

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: I'll be alright. Just remember the things I said. Take care of yourself.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: The fences make a safe pathway to Stalag Seventeen. That's where we live. That's where you gonna live, too. Hell's half acre. It's not a nice place. Them boys there is prisoners. What's their punishment? They sent out to the Stalag for a few weeks. That's punishment enough.

Speaker: pregnant woman
Dialogue: How 'bout it, baby. I'm big but I'm beautiful.

Speaker: drunk
Dialogue: HEY, YOU FUCK! YOU FUCK!

Speaker: drunk
Dialogue: I OUGHTA SLICE YOU UP, YOU FUCK! YOU CAN'T PUSH ME AROUND LIKE... PUSH ME AROUND...LIKE...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: This is home, darlin'. Home for us that don't make the grade. Us that ain't...good enough to live inside The Cave. We grow a little food, do a little light manufacturin'...like these here vests, we make these for the massers. We live in our own filth, with bugs and snakes and disease and jungle fever...all the time waitin' to become breakfast for the Bees.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's a tunnel. It's a couple hundred yards. Just keep goin' 'til you reach the end. I'll be right behind you.

Speaker: lukey
Dialogue: Doc Logan! Doc Logan! Dere's a lady dead out dere! Gotta hurry! Gotta hurry! Dunno how long she been dat way! Maybe she gettin' ready to come back.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Bury the head. Call the guard for the rest. Get it off the table for now. We'll bring this new one in.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: The tunnel.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: God. It's almost sun-up.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Who are you? Who are you?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's OK. It's OK, Doc. She's with us.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: This here's the hospital. That's Diesel over there, the big guy. This here's Lukey and that's Doc Logan who's about to cut your tonsils out.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: This here's all the weapons we got. That's why your fancy automatic looks so good to us. We gotta stick it over here with the others for now. They catch us with any kind o' weapon and its death without even askin' your name.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Ammunition. You got ammunition in your pack there? I hope you do or the gun ain't worth much.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We better just hide the whole pack, darlin'. That stuff is just shoutin' out that it come from the mainland. The shit we get is all C.D. rations. Aspirins and

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Let's go. You look like you could use some shut eye. Me too. We can all get acquainted tomorrow.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: How do we know she's alright? How do we know?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: How do we know she's alright? How do we know?

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: Are you alright, Doc? You look... you look real bad.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I have looked bad for four years. Everyone in the world has looked bad for four years. Thank God looks don't matter as much as they once did.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: This just ain't your day, is it, darlin' Sarah.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Three more minutes. Then you can sleep. You gotta stay with it for three more minutes.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: How do we know she's alright? How do we know?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: They supply us with disinfectant and dope. Sex, drugs and rock-and-roll. What more could anyone ask for? Most around here ain't interested in changin' their lives. The folks you met...me and them and a couple others is the whole rebel army. Nobody else gives a shit...and they're afraid o' Rhodes.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: They seem to be havin' a good time. Some punishment.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You disappear in here, darlin'. You get a knife in yer belly or too much shit in yer veins. You get lost out here and nobody's gonna notice. Rhodes, he counts on that. It all makes for food in the freezers.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: This is your hotel. I'm not gonna stay here with you but I'll always be close. You gonna hafta take care o' yourself like you said you was able to do.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Some may notice that you're new. Just deny it. You'll get away with it. Nobody really looks at each other around here. Go on in. Get some sleep.

Speaker: fisher
Dialogue: Alright! Way ta go, Kemosabe!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: They won't learn to use forks if they don't like the breakfast you're serving, Ted.

Speaker: fisher
Dialogue: The fork is like a game to them. If they get into the game maybe they'll learn to like the food.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: It won't work.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: It's alright! Leave him alone!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Have you seen Julie Grant this morning?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: She should be in the behaviour rooms.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: She's not. Hasn't shown up yet.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Good morning, Bub.

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: I think he wants you to watch.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: OK, Bub. Do your stuff.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Very good, Bub. That's....very good.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Where the hell have you been?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Julie. Are you alright?  You were missed this morning. I need you. I don't want you getting your ass in hot water. I won't be able to help you if...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I don't need any help from you!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Julie...JULIE!

Speaker: prosecutor
Dialogue: He was found with a government-issue short- wave transmitter in his quarters. He's charged with the theft of that equipment from a government installation and with possession of an illegal radio.

Speaker: prosecutor
Dialogue: I can only suggest that the court rule in favour of the ultimate penalty for this traitor.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: You always recommend the ultimate penalty, Tommy Lee. You and Rhodes.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: All those...AGAINST...the ultimate penalty raise yer hands.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Ya mean ta say nobody's gonna object to the ultimate penalty in this here case? Well, what if I object? What if I object to the ultimate penalty.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: There's been a whole lotta swingin' influence and swingin' weight arountyere lately. Does anybody at all give two shits fer what I think any more? Well, I'm a- gonna let this guy off. How d'yall like that? And I want the word ta git out I let 'im off. I let 'im off. Not this council. Maybe I can improve my image rountyere.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Yer sentenced ta hard labour. Stalag Seventeen. A year.

Speaker: prisoner
Dialogue: WHY DON'T YOU KILL ME! I PREFER TO DIE! I DON'T WANT TO LIVE WITH... WITH THIS KIND OF...SIN!

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: WELL, PISS ON YOU, MISTER! I JUST SAVED YOUR ASS! YOU DAMN WELL BETTER NOT GO HOLLERIN' LIKE THAT IN HERE!

Speaker: prisoner
Dialogue: I SPIT ON YOU! THE ULTIMATE PENALTY FOR YOU! BURN IN HELL...FOR THE ULTIMATE SIN! PIG! ALL OF YOU! PIGS!

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Well, Miss Henried, what a coincidence. You're just in time fer a case that seems ta concern you. Guess you didn't care about the other proceedin's we been dealin' with here this mornin'.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I was...busy. In the lab.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Well, you managed ta make it here jus' in time fer this case, didn't ya?

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Sir. In the matter of the State versus Private Tyler, I don't want to...

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Sir, Tyler is innocent of any crime against the State. Captain Rhodes is...

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Miss Henried, I think you better...

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: ...Captain Rhodes is trying to...

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: MISS HENRIED, SHUT THE HELL UP!!!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: I don't want to take up a lot of time with this. Mr Tyler shot a prisoner against orders. There are eyewitnesses. I've reprimanded Tyler and I've had him sent outside. It's as simple as that.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Ya had 'im sent ta the Stalag? That's all ya did to 'im?

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: The prisoner was dying, sir. Tyler acted out of a sense of mercy. I don't believe Tyler to be dangerous, General. He just needs...discipline. Two or three months outside will teach him...discipline.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Sir. It's quite clear that...

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: SHUT UP, MISS HENRIED! I TOL' YA B'FORE!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: THIS IS A TRAVESTY! CAPTAIN RHODES IS...

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: SIDDOWN, YOUNG LADY! I DONE YUP A SHIT-LOAD O' FAVOURS AND I AIN'T NEVER YET ASKED FER NOTHIN' IN RETURN! NOW HOW'D YOU LIKE TA SPEND TWO WEEKS UP T'THE VEGETABLE FARM YERSELF? THAT'S WHAT IT'LL BE IF YA DON'T SIDDOWN AN' SHUT THE HELL UP!

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Now I think Captain's punishment is fair, considerin'. In fact I think you ain't got shit ta complain about.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I'm sorry, General, if I...spoke out of turn. It's just that...Mr Tyler is not here to defend himself. He has no representation. I don't believe due process is being served by...

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Listen, Missy. I am the only due process that has ta be served aroun' tyere and one of the people doin' the servin' from now on is gonna be you. Now you been prancin' aroun' the Cave like yer ass was glass fer long enough! All that's

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: gonna change, young lady. Now if you still got a statement you'd like ta make, you can jus' hold onto it 'til tonight.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Tonight?

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: That's right. 'Bout eight, if that suits. We'll start out in my gymnasium an' progress on from there...to various other forms o' physical therapy.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: AWRITE. C'MON LADIES. OFF WITH IT... AND ON WITH IT...HA HA HA...

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Oh, Lordy, Lordy...I'm drunk as a skunk. Look at this...will ya jus' loooooook at these lovelies! Say, Henried, you ever try it with another woman?

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: I've tried it with boys. Too strenuous.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Folks...I just couldn't resist. How d'yall like those? How do those taste?

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Fresh from the freezers, folks. It's what...THEY...EAT!

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Just kiddin' folks. Just kiddin'. Would I do a thing like that? I ask ya now, would I? Hah ha ha ha ha...

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: The great state of Florida. People came here fer years ta die. Retire and expire. The rest o' the country used ta think we was nothin' but a bunch o' farts and fogies. Hah! Now this here's the new Capital o' the World! Hah! They came here...died...went to hell...and the Devil sent 'em back as an army. Hah! General Gasparilla's army...MY ARMY!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: We think there are other cities surviving. We think maybe Detroit... there's some signalling out of Philly.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: There's no place like this place. Warm climate. This facility. Christ, there ain't nothin' like this no-damn-where! Even the Feds knew that. That's why they stored so much o' their shit down here. It's all mine now. All mine. Just let 'em try ta come after us down here, which they will some day...take a likin' ta what all we got an' come after us. They'll hafta get past my army! An army that ain't afraid ta die...ha ha ha...'cause it's awreddy DAID! HA HA HA HA....

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: It's not a very big army. And small as it is you won't be able to continue feeding it for very long. We've got to find ways of getting them to respond without relying on...

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: You'll find the ways, Miss Mary. And when ya do...we'll sail on over to the mainland...or any other damn mainland fer that matter...and start us a recruitin' program. There's millions o' Bees out there jus' waitin' fer' a General ta lead 'em on ta vict'ry!

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Well, hi there, y'all.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: REVEILLE! REVEILLE! RISE AND SHINE!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: We found two white Bees in the jungle with their heads chopped open. I want to know who's going outside the compound. I want to know how they're going out. I want to know why they're going out. Until I get these answers...each morning...some of you will die.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Let me go! I'm the one he wants. This is all happening because of me. If I turn myself in...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He's just finding another reason for bumpin' us off. Don't ya see. He needs us ta die. He needs our bodies.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: It's alright. I'm a friend. I need help and so do you. What's a safe place to talk?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Ain't no place safe.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Look...I know you have no reason to trust me. I've got friends in the Cave. I got some stuff comin' out this mornin'. I'm gonna try to get off the island.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: I'm gonna have this stuff sent over to the hospital...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: The hospital?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Yeah. My stuff's all marked with red crosses so nobody gets too nosey. Meet me at the hospital after the supplies come in. Maybe we can find a place there to talk.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Maybe.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Hey, Tricks. Some detail they got you on.

Speaker: tricks
Dialogue: Not as bad as yours, pal.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: What'dya get?

Speaker: tricks
Dialogue: Rafts. Two 38s. A little ammo.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: We need fuel, and a couple automatics.

Speaker: tricks
Dialogue: Hey, you. Those two on the bottom. Don't open those yet. They might be from the wrong shipment. Just keep 'em around 'til I can check.

Speaker: lukey
Dialogue: Yessir. I never open 'em. Nossir. I keep 'em innaback for you.

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: He's a spy. A spy for Rhodes.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Give him a chance.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What'dya tell that soldier, soldier? You tell him we was rebels?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: He's my contact for Chrissake! There's two crates. Can you get me into the hospital?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: There ya go. Complete with air canisters...little motors.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We got a boat.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I say we got a boat. Can you get other stuff?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: I got some fuel comin' out and, I hope, some automatic rifles.

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: He's just tryin' to win us over. This doesn't prove anything.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'm gonna trust him, Diesel. He already knows who we are and we ain't got a bunch o' time to mess around with Rhodes shootin' up the joint every mornin'.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Can't walk around here with these. Let's just leave 'em here 'til we ready ta use 'em.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Take it away from me. Quickly. Take it! Take it!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Sorry. I'm sorry. I'll, er...I'll be alright...in a moment.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You're sick, Doc. You been sick for a while now. Too sick to be workin' with us on this raid.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You've helped us enough, providin' cover, hidin' us out. Let the rest of us handle the physical stuff. It's too much for you.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: It's my fight as much as yours. The things they made me do...the things they made...me...do. I want so see Rhodes destroyed. I want to see all of them, all of them destroyed. It's my duty...in the eyes of God. In the eyes of God.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: It won't work. That's pure nitro you're dealin' with there. That stuff can blow if you look at is funny. What're you gonna do, walk into the Cave carryin' those tubes on feather pillows? You don't have a complete layout of the place. Even if you manage to avoid a fight you won't know where to go.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We're hopin' you can show us where ta go, Toby.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Oh, no. I'm tryin' to get off this island alive. I'll help you all I can but I'm not goin' in there on a suicide mission. What can you hope to accomplish? Some radios maybe? A supply room or two? You'll all be killed and in a few weeks they'll be back to business as usual. That place was built to withstand nuclear attack! What are you gonna do with a half-dozen guns and a few sticks of nitro?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We're gonna blow up the powder magazine.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We know what's down there. We did the loading' and unloadin' when the stuff came ashore in the early days. A direct hit oughta do more than a few weeks worth o' damage.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: A direct hit'll blow the top off this whole island! How're you gonna fuse the stuff? How're you gonna leave yourself time to get out?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: If we don't get out it's a small price to pay.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: You're fuckin' out of your minds! There's two hundred people down there. You gonna murder two hundred people?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Sinners! Animals! Filth! Doing the work of the Devil!

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: What about the people here in the camp? If they don't get blown to kingdom come their food'll be destroyed, their water, medical supplies. They won't have any more power. This island can't support them all, they'll be doomed. Count me out, friends. I'm gonna get my ass outa here. Anybody wants to come along is welcome.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: I wanna see Rhodes burn just a much as you do...but all those people. We don't have the right to be their judges... just like they don't have the right to be our judges.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We know what we must do. It's written for us in the Bible. "They shall be driven from the land of the living down to the world of the dead. That is the fate of those who care nothing for God."

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Toby's right. They're not gonna sit around with their fingers up their asses while we bust up their toys.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Datura.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Datura Metel. The Devil's Trumpet. Don't worry. I ain't goin' religioso again. It's a flower that grows on these islands. Where I come from the voodoo priests used it whenever they needed a Mickey Finn. It's toxic. Ground up you can put it in a drink or inject it...or...in a sealed area it might be introduced through the ventilation system.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Datura! Miguel knew it! Datura, he was shouting! Datura Metel!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We always planned to use it. We got some ground up already...but we could never find enough.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: There's hundreds of 'em. Right where we landed our boat.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: This stuff really works? No shit?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Quicker than gas. And it smells a lot prettier. It usually don't kill but it puts ya under fer a good night's sleep.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: If you could knock out the central communications room you could foul up their whole intercom system. Then, if you move fast enough, stay ahead of 'em...without bein' able to signal each other, they might have a hard time catchin' you.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I say it's poetic. Pure calypso, brother. The Devil's Trumpet blowin' the notes o' doom for the Devil's troops. Ha ha ha ha ha...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Looks like just two. We can take 'em when the time comes.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We're only about a quarter-mile from Cave entrance number five.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: That entrance is closest to the labs and the Bee cages.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Come on. Let's go.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Just stand guard for now. Spell us after a while. Can't breathe this grass too long or somebody hafta carry you home.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Maintenance shafts run behind all the main rooms. Nobody's in those at night. You can use them to get around in. Hit the power governors first. Kick a surge into their computer network and you erase everything stored in the memory. Then...over in here...that's where the cages are...

Speaker: lukey
Dialogue: I coulden stop 'em, boss. No way I coulda stop 'em, I sweah. They tie me up and stick dis...  ...they stick dis in my mouf. You b'lieve dis?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Jesus! They're gonna try to do it! They're goin' in! They got somebody to help 'em from the inside!

Speaker: lukey
Dialogue: They din' get da pistols. You know dem pistols you buddy send in widda raffs.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: I gotta get Mary out. Tricks. We gotta go now! Tonight! Right away!

Speaker: sally
Dialogue: We're not ready.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Well...if ya think about it...we as ready as we ever gonna be. How was they carryin' the nitro, Lukey?

Speaker: lukey
Dialogue: Oh, me. You ain't gonna b'lieve dis, neider. You ain't, I sweah. They put it inta Spidah's body.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: They what?

Speaker: lukey
Dialogue: De Doc. He cut up Spidah here and here and here...all ovah. He stick dem tubes in dere, like undah da skin...an' den he sews 'em all up. I sweah. I sweah, sweah, sweah!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I know it hurts. But it won't be long. Then all the pain will be over. Oh, I wish you could hear me. GOD, GIVE HER THE EARS TO HEAR ME SO SHE KNOWS I DON'T WANT HER TO HURT SO!

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: Quiet!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Oh, yes. Quiet. Yes. We must be quiet.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: FALLEN ANGEL! THIS IS THE JUDGEMENT DAY WHEN YOU WILL BURN FOR YOUR SINS! THE LORD WILL CAST YOU DOWN TO THE LOWER REACHES AND YOU SHALL FOREVER KNOW....

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...YOU SHALL FOREVER KNOW THE PAIN... THE PAIN...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: YOU SHALL FOREVER KNOW THE PAIN OF HELL... THE PAIN OF HELL.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...the pain of Hell...the pain...the pain...

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Okay. Lemme have 'em.

Speaker: radio man
Dialogue: What's that? Smell it?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: Dunno. Must be comin' from outside. Kinda nice.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Don't move!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Open the outer door. Move it!

Speaker: young man
Dialogue: Hey! What the hell.....?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ENOUGH! ENOUGH! ENOUGH! ENOUGH!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What...what is this? Who...?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: It's alright, it's alright, my dear. You've simply helped us do the Lord's work.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What...what have you done to her?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: God forgive us. Forgive us the pain we inflict as surgeons. We'll be in Heaven, child. Soon. We'll be with Him in Heaven.

Speaker: spider
Dialogue: Na...na...ak...aaaaaaaaaa...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: NO YOU DON'T I CAN'T LET YOU DO THAT! I CAN'T!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Outa the way, Doc! Outa the way!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: Keep the woman covered.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: Don't be alarmed. We're impregnable. Stay where you are. Nothing will happen to any of you. You're safe here. Men.

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: Well, c'mon, ladies and gents. Who says we gotta let our evenin' get spoiled? Simon sez...GET DOWN!!!

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: That's the general alarm. Jesus! They musta got in!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What you wanna do?

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: What's goin' on?

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: You'd hold us back. We have to go on.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Hmmmmmm? Oh, yes. Go on.

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: Maps. Yes. She was supposed to bring us maps.

Speaker: diesel
Dialogue: Alright. Let's go.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Come on, Mary. Answer. ANSWER!

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Tricks, it's Tyler. We're inside.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: No. There's some loonies from outside. They're gonna try to blow the powder magazine.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Find Mary. If you can get help do it. We're gonna hit the power station and haul-ass outa here. We'll be at exit five...that's exit five in exactly ten minutes.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: And Mary! You gotta find Mary!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Those buttons won't work! The evacuation command overrides them.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: CUT ME LOOSE! PLEASE! CUT ME LOOSE!

Speaker: gasparilla
Dialogue: STAY HERE! STAY PUT! WE'LL BE ALRIGHT! WE'RE SAFE HERE! JUST AS SAFE AS ANYWHERE 'TIL WE FIND OUT WHAT'S GOIN' ON!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: What is it? What's happening?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: It's an evacuation signal. The radios are out. People are panicking.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: What should we do?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: God. I, er...I dunno what to say. It could be a real evacuation or it could just be a glitch in the system. Wait here for now. I'll...I'll make sure you get the word what to do, okay?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Please...hurry...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We'll be in Heaven soon. We'll all be in Heaven soon.  Pain. God forgive the pain inflicted by surgeons. We must atone. We must atone for our sins.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We must...atone. We must.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: WE WILL ATONE. WE WILL BE THE SACRIFICE...THE COMMUNION...WE OFFER OURSELVES UP...OUR SOUL...AND OUR BODIES...

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Tricks! What's going on?

Speaker: tricks
Dialogue: Toby's in the Cave. We're gonna make our move. There's rebels out to blow the powder magazine. Come on. Come with us.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Where are you goin' out?

Speaker: tricks
Dialogue: Exit five.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: See ya there.

Speaker: tricks
Dialogue: SEVEN MINUTES, MARY. EXACTLY SEVEN MINUTES!

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: THIS WAY. OVER HERE! SHOOT! SHOOT THEM! SHOOT TO KILL! IN THE HEAD!

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Captain...CAPTAIN!

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Tricks...Jesus...

Speaker: tricks
Dialogue: I'm alright. Let's go.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: HENRIED! WHERE ARE YOU GOING?

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: STOP THEM! SHOOT!

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: The...the children, sir.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: After them then! I want them stopped! That woman is dangerous!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: It's alright. I don't think they'll hurt us. Try to stay calm.

Speaker: rhodes
Dialogue: SHOOT IT OPEN!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: They're coming! They're coming!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: NO...BLUTO...I'M TRYING TO...

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Look. It's good to shoot the circles. Good. Good.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: THAT'S IT! THAT'S IT!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: It's...he was...one who came to the island with me.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Come on. No time.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: He was killed...five days ago.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Maybe...maybe he wasn't dead. Are you sure he was dead when you left him?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Look at him. A hundred bullets. You tell me. Was he dead?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Five days...and he hasn't...risen. He hasn't risen.

Speaker: toby
Dialogue: Come on. There's no time. There's no time to lose.

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: WHO IS IT? WHO'S OUT THERE?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Damn you, island. Damn you ta Hell and worse!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No. Don't. Wait. Wait to see if... wait until it's necessary.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Me too...please.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Satan ain't sent this man back. Not yet, anyway. So we all hopin' that maybe he's up there with you, Lord. This might be the first decent soul we been able ta offer ya in quite a few years. That's a fact. We just gonna... pray, Lord. We gonna pray that what seems ta be happenin' here...is really happenin'...and I'm gonna take the chance and speak these words that I ain't been able ta speak for so long...

Speaker: the others
Dialogue: Amen.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Just me. I'll take the next shift.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: How long do we have to watch him?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Forever, darlin'. Forever. 'Til he turns ta dust and blows away on the wind.
